acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: 「Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, a LD50 value is >16 g/kg for rabbits (RTECS (2008)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, mortality was 4/6 at 6000 ppm in rats exposed for 8-hour at 35 degC (ACGIH (2007)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on a LC50 value of 3000 ppm/4h for rats (mortality of 3/6 at 3000 ppm/4h) (ACGIH (2007)), the substance was classified into Category 4. Since the value is lower than 90% of saturated vapour pressure concentration (6618 ppmV), the test was considered to be conducted for vapour with almost no included mists and classification criteria for gas were adopted.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of 3.5 g/kg for rats (ACGIH (2007), PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into "Not classified" in JIS Classification (correspond to Category 5 in GHS classification).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified into Category 3 from flash point 43 degC (ICSC (2001), Hommel (1996)) and 59 degC (NFPA (13th, 2002)).

hazardous_to_ozone.rationale: This substance is not listed in Annexes to the Montreal Protocol.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on a report that eye contact with the liquid substance can cause transient corneal injury in humans (ACGIH (2001)), the substance was classified into Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, there is a result of "mild" in a rabbit Draize test (RTECS (2008)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In a rat 13-week test (410 and 820 mg/kg/day), neuropathy was observed. However, the exposure route is unknown. (PATTY (5th, 2001)). If the exposure route was oral or dermal, the substance corresponds to "Not classified". There is a report that ketones and related substance produce "giant axonal neuropathy" (PATTY (5th, 2001)). It is reported in HSFS (1999) that this chemical has not been adequately evaluated to determine whether nerve damage could occur. Classification was not possible due to lack of availability of relevant data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Respiratory tract irritation, Narcotic effects
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on reports of symptoms of irritation of the respiratory tract in rats and mice (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)) and irritating to the respiratory tract in humans (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001), ICSC (2001), HSFS (1999), SITTIG (47th, 2002)), the substance was classified into Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation). Based on reports that ataxia, decrease in activity, and coma occurred but resolved in rats (ACGIH (2001)) and that the substance can cause headache, vomiting, dizziness, staggering, and unconsciousness in humans (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001), ICSC (2001), SITTIG (47th, 2002)), the substance was classified into Category 3 (narcotic effects).
